job_title: Sr. HR Generalist in Austin, TX
pros: Hospice Austin has a team dynamic that I have not seen at many other places. There is support and appreciation of the employees working and I feel like everyone is willing to jump in to do what is needed to take care of the patients and each other.
cons: The healthcare industry post-covid surge is still trying to catch up. Staffing is changing based on workforce but Hospice Austin does a great job of maintaining proper staffing levels.

review_title: right mission but leadership and focus changing
job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Austin, TX
pros:
- Incredible and passionate employees
- Right mission 
- Important work that is gratifying
cons:
- Increasing caseloads making patient focused care harder
- Change CEO with poor leadership and focus - not listening to bedside staff/needs
-Frequent staff turnover and poor nurse retention
-Moving away from focus on patient centered care - always add more responsibilities onto nurses.

pros: Strong leadership, support and peer support as well.
cons: No major cons, you get what you put into the work.

review_title: They could be so much better...
job_title: Hospice Social Worker in Austin, TX
pros: Social wokers, and some of the nurses at Hospice Austin are some of the best people I have ever encountered. They will take time to answer questions, when you have them.
cons: Upper management is atrocious. Their words mention Team, but it doesn't feel like one. The insurance is terrible.

review_title: Amazing hospice care organization for the community!
pros: Hospice Austin is a great place to work with some amazing coworkers who care about the mission of providing excellent care to those who need their services. It was an honor to work with one of the largest nonprofit hospice providers in central Texas!
cons: Pay needs to be even more competitive in order to keep talented, experienced and devoted staff on board, especially the pay for CRN's and receptionists.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Austin, TX
pros: Professional, caring, fair, good employer
cons: Now I can think of

review_title: Do not stop here, keep up the job search
pros: Hospice Austin is a mission driven company that provides a much needed service for the community. There are some excellent nurses here!
cons: Management is very very disorganized. They cut so many corners when it comes to safety I am surprised they are still open. Worst on boarding experience, terrible communication, supervisors have no idea what they are doing.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Austin, TX
pros: Large Company with lots of benefits
cons: Leadership plays favorites, cliquish and unprofessional

pros: The group of social workers at this agency is top notch supportive and collaborative with each other
cons: Caseloads can be overwhelming, pressure to complete DNRS , turnover in upper management is pretty heavy

pros: Caring team, management. Very supportive environment with resources to do your work.
cons: Sometimes short staffed on weekends.

pros: Helping Familes and Patients with care and support
cons: Some coworkers make working there uncomfortable due to lack of management support.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Austin, TX
pros: (1) Great work experience puts you in all kinds of different environments ( 2) Do not require hospice experience, willing to train/educate you (3) Most of the Doc's are pleasant to call and work with and most everyone in various office dept's helpful and friendly (4) Flexible in terms of FT nurses can drop back to PRN while working on education,maternity, etc... OR even learn various positions like admissions, facilities, on call, even pediatrics.  (5) Salary is less what other smaller hospices CM's earn, BUT you REALLY get to be OFF, thanks to an awesome On Call team that handles all after hr's, weekends, and Holidays and NO Admissions!!
cons: (1) ALWAYS CHANGING- updating policies/ procedures! (but not a con for me I don't mind change but worth mentioning) (2) Decided to leave Hospice Austin after receiving other attractive job offers in combination w bad experiences/ total lack of support from  Blue Team" Leader" ( case management is color coded  by areas/districts). But some individuals teach you the best lessons by showing you how NOT to behave and lead others!

job_title: RN Case Manager in Austin, TX
pros:
Hospice Austin has been in business for a very long time, it is centrally located and easy to find.
Hospice Austin has fairly good benefits.
cons: If you are not American- Caucasian, you will not be there very long, they are very cliquish and if you do not belong to their clique, no matter how good your work, they will make you leave.

review_title: Mostly great coworkers but chronically understaffed
pros: Compassionate, caring colleagues who believe in the work they're doing.
cons: Upper management is solely focused on expanding the company and admitting patients, and there is a perpetual staffing crisis which affects the workloads of all clinical staff. Unmanageably high caseloads and constant patient crises make this job unsustainable for the long-term. Social workers feel consistently unsupported, and management seems deaf to their concerns.

review_title: Best place to work so far
job_title: RN Visit Nurse in Austin, TX
pros: Autonomy, teamwork, coworkers, proper amount of time for patient care, collaboration, adequate supplues and tools to work, administration and physicians.
cons: Pay competitiveness could be better.  EMR for documentation needs update.  12 hours shifts option aside from weekends.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Austin, TX
pros: Beautiful Organization. We stand for a better way of dealing with death. It helps the loved ones better cope instead of being nervous and left with many questions.
cons: None. The Best Hospice Company I have ever worked for.

pros: Opportunity to change roles in company
cons:
Money is poor
Workloads are way too full
Computer work takes up *0-90% of time, instead of [patient care time

review_title: I have had an incredible experience with great people at this company.
pros: Fantastic company with great people who are dedicated to a mission.
cons: limited advancement within the company

pros: Love the coworkers and the work we do

Pay could be more competitive
